text: Oof, I'm learning that a lot of Java developers think a multidimensional array is a vector of vectors.

elements.text: Oof, I'm learning that a lot of Java developers think a multidimensional array is a vector of vectors.

text: Mind expounding on this some more? I've run into the same thing and was curious what your insights have been as I have been wondering what causes this pattern of thinking.

text:
The Java work I have does uses something like this:
<https://javadoc.scijava.org/ImgLib2/net/imglib2/img/array/ArrayImg.html>
<https://github.com/imglib/imglib2/blob/master/src/main/java/net/imglib2/img/array/ArrayImg.java>

While very sophisticated, it is a bit challenging to use.

text:
Obtaining a specific pixel is a three step process:
1. Obtain a `RandomAccess`: <https://javadoc.scijava.org/ImgLib2/net/imglib2/img/array/ArrayRandomAccess.html>
2. Set the pixel coordinate via `RandomAccess.setPosition`
3. Call `RandomAccess.get()`  to obtain the value.

elements.text:
Obtaining a specific pixel is a three step process:
1. Obtain a
RandomAccess
2. Set the pixel coordinate via
RandomAccess.setPosition
3. Call
RandomAccess.get()
to obtain the value.
